title: Red Sox have reportedly discussed trading reliever Jordan Hicks in search of an infielder
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox have considered trading reliever Jordan Hicks and starter Brayan Bello to acquire an infielder.
Jordan Hicks, acquired in the Rafael Devers trade, posted an 8.20 ERA in 2025 before an injury.
Boston has linked to infielders like Nico Hoerner, Isaac Paredes, and free agent Eugenio Suarez.

title: Breakout Patriots LB K’Lavon Chaisson wants to re-sign with New England in free agency
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots linebacker K'Lavon Chaisson wants to re-sign with New England after an impressive breakout season.
Chaisson recorded 7.5 sacks, 18 QB hits, 10 tackles for loss, and two forced fumbles in the 2025 regular season.
Chaisson credited coordinators Josh McDaniels and Zak Kuhr for his successful year and Patriots' Super Bowl run.

title: Patriots DC Terrell Williams declared cancer-free after four months battling prostate cancer
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots Defensive Coordinator Terrell Williams declared cancer-free, battling aggressive prostate cancer since September.
Williams underwent five rounds of chemotherapy successfully, now set to join the Patriots at Super Bowl LX.
Williams continued team involvement throughout treatment, serving as an inspiration for players during playoffs.

title: Cambridge becomes first Mass. city to endorse Plant Based Treaty — but what does that mean?
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Cambridge City Council unanimously endorses the Plant Based Treaty, becoming the first Massachusetts city to support the global initiative.
The treaty aims to complement the Paris Agreement, promoting sustainable, equitable food systems to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
Local communities push for plant-based diets, citing health and environmental benefits, while ensuring accessibility and awareness efforts.

title: 5 Catherine O’Hara movies and TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Catherine O'Hara, a Canadian actress known for 'Schitt's Creek,' died at 71 after a brief illness.
'A Mighty Wind' featuring O'Hara and Eugene Levy is available with ads on YouTube.
'Beetlejuice Beetlejuice' with O'Hara reprising her role is streaming on HBO Max.

title: Mike Vrabel doesn’t buy that Patriots’ white uniforms provide good luck: ‘Hope the tooth fairy comes tonight’
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel dismisses superstition about Patriots' white uniforms providing good luck ahead of Super Bowl LX.
Patriots are choosing to wear white jerseys for Super Bowl LX, maintaining a 6-0 season record in them.
Historically, teams wearing white in the Super Bowl have a strong 37-22 record, but recent wins favor home jerseys.

title: Dave Epstein on how this Atlantic winter storm will impact Mass. — and how it largely won’t
author: David Epstein
bullets: Cape Cod and the Islands to receive most snow impact from the Atlantic winter storm, with up to 6 inches possible.
Boston and areas west of I-495 likely see minimal snowfall, with a coating to 1 inch expected.
Potential for minor to moderate coastal flooding in Eastern Mass. due to strong winds and high tides.

title: Celtics reportedly unlikely to take ‘huge swings’ ahead of NBA trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics reportedly unlikely to pursue major trades before February 5 deadline, targeting moderate roster improvements instead.
Player Anfernee Simons, earning $27.7 million this season, is a potential trade piece if salary needs matching.
Team is considering a frontcourt addition, possibly targeting Ivica Zubac from Clippers to strengthen big man depth.

title: These 5 Boston restaurants received all-alcohol licenses under new legislation
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Five Boston restaurants approved to trade beer-and-wine licenses for all-alcohol licenses under new legislation provisions.
The restaurants include 89 Charles, Bebop, Carmelina's, New England Wicked Craft Company, and Serafina.
The new licenses are non-transferable and aim to circumvent high costs of private market due to state license cap.

title: Entangled right whale found dead off North Carolina coast
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A 4-year-old North Atlantic right whale was found dead off North Carolina, entangled in fishing gear.
The whale, named Division, was identified by New England Aquarium scientists and had been entangled since December 2025.
Division's death marks the first detected North Atlantic right whale fatality since May 2024, according to NOAA.
